remarks: Alternate definition of an isomorphism of a category, according to definition 3.8 in [Adamek] p. 28.  (Contributed by AV, 10-Apr-2017.)
statement:
dfiso2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
dfiso2.h $e |- H = ( Hom ` C ) $.
dfiso2.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
dfiso2.i $e |- I = ( Iso ` C ) $.
dfiso2.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
dfiso2.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
dfiso2.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( X H Y ) ) $.
dfiso2.1 $e |- .1. = ( Id ` C ) $.
dfiso2.o $e |- .o. = ( <. X , Y >. ( comp ` C ) X ) $.
dfiso2.p $e |- .* = ( <. Y , X >. ( comp ` C ) Y ) $.
dfiso2 $p |- ( ph -> ( F e. ( X I Y ) <-> E. g e. ( Y H X ) ( ( g .o. F ) = ( .1. ` X ) /\ ( F .* g ) = ( .1. ` Y ) ) ) ) $.
$d .* g $.
$d .1. g $.
$d .o. g $.
$d C g $.
$d F g $.
$d H g $.
$d I g $.
$d X g $.
$d Y g $.
$d g ph $.
